original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares edge down in mid day on holidays approaching
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares edged down in mid day trade on holidays approaching pushing a low turnover and a quiet market, an analyst said.
“With holidays around the corner, this sentiment was expected and is slowing the market,” an analyst said.
The main All Share Price Index (ASPI) was down -0.44% or 40.52 points to 9,196.41, while the most liquid index S&P SL20 was down 0.14 percent or 3.79 points to 2,672.69.
The market generated a slow turnover of 492 million rupees during 1130 hours.
Turnover was produced from crossings of National Development Bank, CT Holdings and Cargills.
Analysts forecast that the revenue will be just under a billion and will produce a turnover similar to the previous session when the market generated only 569 million rupees during its closure.
Top losers were Bukit Darah, Commercial Bank and Hatton National Bank. (Colombo/Apr04/2023)
